intro: Senecio meuselii, commonly known as the Meusel's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by distinctive white to pale yellow seeds. Senecio meuselii is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
